definition: to check through (a document)/to proofread/to review (troops)
school/military officer/CL:所[suo3]
to proofread/to check/to compare
to inspect/to review/to read/to peruse/to go through/to experience

sentences.english: He sent it for my review and I had revised it slightly. The resulting file is attached.
sentences.chinese: 他傳來給我校閱而我已略作修訂，完稿檔案附呈。

sentences.english: Would you please blue-pencil this manuscript?
sentences.chinese: 你能校閱一下這份手稿嗎？

sentences.english: Disciple Jing Xing submitted a translation of this article for my review.
sentences.chinese: 弟子敬行提交此文章的譯文供我校閱。

sentences.english: The article has been revised for clarity.
sentences.chinese: 本文章已經被明確校閱過。

sentences.english: I had reviewed and slightly revised it.
I had revised it, and marked my revision in yellow.
sentences.chinese: 我已校閱過並以黃色標示出我所修改之處。

sentences.english: The positive function of peer review in teaching foreign language writing is well recognized.
sentences.chinese: 同儕校閱在寫作教學中的積極作用得到了普遍認可。

sentences.english: Asian countries value education, speaking foreign languages and are more engaged.
sentences.chinese: 亞洲國家重視校閱，講外語還有更多的慾望。

sentences.english: Kindly for your checking and revision(English translation), please.
sentences.chinese: 請慈悲的校閱並修訂此英文譯文。

sentences.english: I have revised the work and highlighted my revisions in yellow.
sentences.chinese: 我已經校閱此篇並將我校訂的地方以黃色標示出來。

sentences.english: They, in turn, memorized it, wrote it down, and reviewed it with the Prophet Muhammad .
sentences.chinese: 他們依次記誦並寫下它，再與先知穆罕默德一起校閱。

sentences.english: No combat ready unit has ever passed inspection.
sentences.chinese: 從來沒有一支完成戰備的單位能通過校閱。

definition: Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Qing Dynasty
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
annals/chronicle
to check and correct
Liu Yi (-285), famous incorruptible official of Western Jin dynasty the Western Jin dynasty 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316)/Liu Yi (-412), general of Eastern Jin dynasty 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420)
to comment on/commentary

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
to make a catalogue/catalogue/list
newspaper cutting/clippings
to revise/to examine and revise
famous school/noted school of thought
Jingshan county in Jingmen 荊門|荆门[Jing1 men2], Hubei
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to be in overall charge/to oversee
imperial edict
to comment/a point by point commentary
